titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Peter Praa certificate 1977.355
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was originally processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-11-22 20:16:25 +0000.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.abstract: One photostat copy of a certificate, dated 1702, appointing Peter Praa a Captain in the Bushwick Militia in the regiment of Colonel Jacob Van Cortland.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection consists of a single item.

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: Peter (Pieter) Praa (1655-1740) was a prominent landowner in the town of Bushwick in Kings County. He was appointed a Captain in the Bushwick Militia in 1702.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Peter Praa certificate, 1977.355, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This item was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2023.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One photostat copy of a certificate, dated 1702, appointing Peter Praa a Captain in the Bushwick Militia in the regiment of Colonel Jacob Van Cortland. The certificate is issued by Edward Viscount Cornbury, Her Majesty's Captain and Governor in the English Province of New York.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This item is in the public domain. While many items at the Center for Brooklyn History are unrestricted, we do not own reproduction rights to all materials. Be aware of the several kinds of rights that might apply: copyright, licensing and trademarks. The researcher assumes all responsibility for copyright questions.
